benchmark_details.name: eSpatial-Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: eSpatial-Benchmark is a comprehensive dataset including real-world embodied scenarios with fine-grained spatial annotations and adaptive task difficulty levels, designed to rigorously evaluate performance in embodied spatial reasoning tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the eSpatial-Benchmark is to provide a robust evaluation tool for embodied spatial reasoning tasks.

data.source: Derived from open-source datasets like RoboMIND, MMbench, GQA, and SEEDBench.
data.annotation: Manual review and automatic generation annotated by experts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the performance of models on the eSpatial-Benchmark dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Results are interpreted based on accuracy metrics for different spatial reasoning tasks, measured against baseline models.
methodology.baseline_results: EmbodiedVSR improved performance across various measures over baseline models.
methodology.validation: Validated through extensive testing on the district data distributions and success in embodied manipulations.
